items.name: Safe Preset – Daily Use
items.description:
Applies a low-risk baseline for cutting junk without breaking features. What this preset does:
• Disables UWP background apps via AppPrivacy policy.
• Keeps the shell, Store, updates, and anti-cheat completely intact.
• Disables a small set of non-essential services: - DiagTrack (telemetry) - SysMain (old Superfetch) - WSearch (search indexing – search still works, just no indexer) - XblGameSave, XboxNetApiSvc (Xbox helpers) - MapsBroker (offline maps broker) - WerSvc (Windows Error Reporting service – Event Viewer still logs) Requirements:
• Run Falcon Optimizer as Administrator.
• Works on both Microsoft and local accounts.
• Recommended as the first Process Lab pass before going Competitive/Extreme.

items.name: Competitive Preset – ~40–45 Processes
items.description:
Pushes toward ~40–45 total processes on Windows 11 while keeping:
• Epic / Steam / Store working
• Anti-cheat, installers, and updates functional
• Explorer, taskbar, notifications, and networking intact What this preset does, on top of Safe:
• Re-applies Safe (UWP background apps + baseline services).
• Forces svchost merging via SvcHostSplitThresholdInKB to reduce process count.
• Disables extra non-critical services: - diagnosticshub.standardcollector.service, DSSVC, DusmSvc, DiagSvc (diagnostic helpers) - XboxGipSvc (Xbox game input service) - RetailDemo / RetailDemoService (demo features) - WbioSrvc (biometrics), PhoneSvc (phone integration), WalletService (wallet) - RemoteRegistry (remote registry access) - Fax, Spooler (if no printer used)
• Trims harmless scheduled tasks: - ProgramDataUpdater, CEIP consolidator / USB CEIP - MapsUpdateTask, Feedback DMClient tasks Requirements:
• Run Falcon Optimizer as Administrator.
• Recommended: Local Windows account for the cleanest background footprint.
• Do NOT use this on production work machines that need all Windows features.

items.name: Extreme Preset – ~32–38 Processes (Local Account Recommended)
items.description:
This is the most aggressive built-in Process Lab preset.
Goal: push toward ~32–38 total processes on Windows 11 for tournament / grind sessions. Keeps:
• Networking, DNS/DHCP, shell, licensing, Store and installer core intact.
• Anti-cheat and major launchers in most normal setups. Adds on top of Competitive:
• Re-enforces svchost merging.
• Disables Delivery Optimization (DoSvc) – cuts update-related background traffic.
• Disables extra telemetry / compatibility helpers (PcaSvc, DiagTrack again, WerSvc again).
• Disables additional background scheduled tasks: - DiskDiagnostic data collector / resolver - Maps toast / update tasks - Feedback DMClient tasks - WER queue reporting Hard requirements:
• MUST run Falcon Optimizer as Administrator.
• STRONGLY recommended: LOCAL Windows account, not Microsoft account.
• Only use this on a known-good gaming rig where you accept trade-offs.
• For daily browsing/school/work use, stay on Safe or Competitive.

items.name: Disable BITS + Delivery Optimization (Aggressive Background Killer)
items.description:
[Very aggressive] Kills almost all Windows background download logic. What this changes:
• Sets BITS (Background Intelligent Transfer Service) startup to Disabled.
• Sets DoSvc (Delivery Optimization) startup to Disabled (also in Extreme preset).
• Stops both services immediately. Impact:
• Reduces random update/download wakes and some background processes.
• Can break or delay: - Windows Update downloads - Microsoft Store installs/updates - Some app updaters that rely on BITS Requirements:
• Run as Administrator.
• Only enable this if you are okay managing updates manually.
• Recommended for offline/competitive sessions, not everyday use.

items.name: Create Service Backup + Restore Point
items.description: Snapshots current Start types for all managed services and attempts a Windows Restore Point. Required before applying presets.

steps.command: Write-Output "Backup creation is non-destructive and does not require revert."

items.name: Apply Service Preset: Update-Safe
items.description: Disables the full performance service set while protecting Windows Update + driver installation services.

items.name: Apply Service Preset: Performance
items.description: Performance-focused preset with update/driver protection. Uses the same full list with safe guards; combine with custom overrides for per-service tuning.

items.name: Apply Service Preset: Latency
items.description: Latency-focused preset with update/driver protection. Combine with custom overrides for best per-PC results.

items.name: Apply Service Preset: Extreme (Breaks Updates)
items.description: Disables everything in the managed list, including update/driver-critical services. Not recommended unless you know how to recover.

items.name: Restore Services from Backup
items.description: Restores Start types for all managed services from the last backup snapshot.

steps.command: Write-Output "Restore is itself the revert action."

items.name: Create / Open Custom Overrides File
items.description: Creates the overrides JSON (if missing) and opens it so you can set per-service custom Start types (2=Auto, 3=Manual, 4=Disabled) and stop behavior.

steps.command: Write-Output "Custom overrides file creation is non-destructive."

items.name: Capture Baseline Snapshot
items.description: [Analyzer] Records CPU/DPC/ISR %, RAM, process count, and top processes into a JSON baseline file before changes.

steps.command:
Write-Output @"
Baseline capture is read-only and requires no revert.
"@

items.name: Capture AFTER Snapshot & Compare
items.description: [Analyzer] Takes a new snapshot after you change services and compares metrics to the latest baseline.

steps.command:
Write-Output @"
After snapshot and comparison are read-only and require no revert.
"@

items.name: List Running Services & Top Processes
items.description: [Helper] Lists running services and top CPU processes to help you decide which presets or services to test.

steps.command:
Write-Output @"
Listing is read-only and requires no revert.
"@

items.name: Create Backup + Restore Point
items.description: Saves current service start types and attempts a restore point for safe rollback.

items.name: Apply Preset (Update-safe)
items.description: Disables non-essential services while preserving Windows Update and driver install capability.

items.name: Apply Preset (Aggressive)
items.description: High-risk: disables the full service target list including update/driver-related services.

items.name: Restore Services from Backup
items.description: Restores service start types from the last backup snapshot.

items.name: Apply Service Disabler Pack
items.description: Disables a large set of Windows services. Creates a backup of current startup types so you can restore later.

items.name: Restore Service Disabler Backup
items.description: Restores service startup types from the Service Disabler backup file.
